name: @cf/meta/llama-4-scout-17b-16e-instruct
description: Meta's Llama 4 Scout is a 17 billion parameter model with 16 experts that is natively multimodal. These models leverage a mixture-of-experts architecture to offer industry-leading performance in text and image understanding.

task.name: Text Generation
task.description: Family of generative text models, such as large language models (LLM), that can be adapted for a variety of natural language tasks.

prompt.description: The input text prompt for the model to generate a response.

guided_json.description: JSON schema that should be fulfilled for the response.

raw.description: If true, a chat template is not applied and you must adhere to the specific model's expected formatting.

stream.description: If true, the response will be streamed back incrementally using SSE, Server Sent Events.

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the response.

temperature.description: Controls the randomness of the output; higher values produce more random results.

top_p.description: Adjusts the creativity of the AI's responses by controlling how many possible words it considers. Lower values make outputs more predictable; higher values allow for more varied and creative responses.

top_k.description: Limits the AI to choose from the top 'k' most probable words. Lower values make responses more focused; higher values introduce more variety and potential surprises.

seed.description: Random seed for reproducibility of the generation.

repetition_penalty.description: Penalty for repeated tokens; higher values discourage repetition.

frequency_penalty.description: Decreases the likelihood of the model repeating the same lines verbatim.

presence_penalty.description: Increases the likelihood of the model introducing new topics.

messages.description: An array of message objects representing the conversation history.

role.description: The role of the message sender (e.g., 'user', 'assistant', 'system', 'tool').

tool_call_id.description: The tool call id. If you don't know what to put here you can fall back to 000000001

oneOf.description: The content of the message as a string.

url.description: image uri with data (e.g. data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/...). HTTP URL will not be accepted
image uri with data (e.g. data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/...). HTTP URL will not be accepted

tools.description: A list of tools available for the assistant to use.

name.description: The name of the tool. More descriptive the better.

description.description: A brief description of what the tool does.

parameters.description: Schema defining the parameters accepted by the tool.

type.description: The type of the parameters object (usually 'object').
The data type of the parameter.

description.description: A description of the expected parameter.

response.description: The generated text response from the model

usage.description: Usage statistics for the inference request

prompt_tokens.description: Total number of tokens in input

completion_tokens.description: Total number of tokens in output

total_tokens.description: Total number of input and output tokens

tool_calls.description: An array of tool calls requests made during the response generation

name.description: The name of the tool to be called

arguments.description: The arguments passed to be passed to the tool call request
